title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Administrator is directed to use specific programs for entrepreneurial development services, education, and business support. An exception is made for services to small businesses owned by Indian tribes. An annual report on entrepreneurial activities must be submitted to relevant committees. The Administrator must report annually to relevant committees on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, awardees, funding amounts, and responsible individuals for each program. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION.

Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant applicants. The Administrator is required to report annually on data collection activities related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Participation in private partnerships and cosponsorships with the Administration by Small Business Development Centers will not limit them from collecting fees or income related to these partnerships. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amendments to the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Grant awards to SBDCs. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amendments to the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Grant awards to SBDCs. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses affected by a major disaster, regardless of geographic proximity. The Small Business Act allows small business development centers to provide assistance to businesses in disaster-declared areas, ensuring continuity of services and access to recovery facilities. The Small Business Act allows small business development centers to use designated disaster recovery facilities for providing assistance. SEC. 10. INCLUSIONS OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS. Amends the Small Business Act to include educating unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assisting them in starting new businesses.
